body.p: His Eclency the Goverenor of the Common of Kentucky Your Petitioner John C Baker makes known to your Honer that at the June term of of the year 1863 he thinks. He was fined in the Sum of $120.00 under two indictments in Said Court for the offence of retaling Spirtuous Liquer by the retail Small and a Petition was gottin up and Presented to your Predesessor Governor Magoffin and was all remitted by him But twenty dollars and that amount was Respited for twelve months and that time is about Expired and that he has paid all the Costs of the actions that occurd there on and he hops that your honer will remit the remaining $20 as he is a Pore man and has a large and helpless family and but little means of Support and never will in future violate the Laws of his countery if he knows it

P.S. we whos names ar under Signed maks known to your Excencly that we are well acquainted with your Petitioner John C Baker and know him to be a honest Peaceabl and well dispersed citizen a pore man with a Large and helpless family and hope your honer may remit the fine is the Prayer your Petition
